page.title: 03Cornwood's traffic problem
page.content: Cornwood's main highway is a B road, built over 100 yrs. ago. In parts it is quite narrow with sharp bends and hump-backed bridges.Villagers are concerned about the heavy traffic passing through from nearby china-clay works to the A38 dual carriageway. 12- 14 wheeled trucks frequently drive through the village, often having difficulty in passing.The road is badly worn, with many pits, and the pavement is slowly sinking due to lorries mounting it.Cottages beside the road are suffering damage to their foundations.Children have to cross this dangerous road to get to school. The village shop keeper said he didn't mind the busy road, but other people feel that another route should be taken.Protest letters have been written to the Minister of Transport.
